text: The Koshebe massacre took place on 28 November 2020 in the village of Koshebe, Borno State, northeastern Nigeria. About 110 civilians, mostly farmers from Sokoto State, were killed; six others were wounded. The attack occurred as they worked in rice fields 31 kilometers (19 miles) to the northeast of the city of Maiduguri. Crops worth millions of Naira were also destroyed in an attack thought to be carried out by ==References== Category:2020 in Nigeria Category:2020s murders in Africa Category:Borno State Category:2020s crimes in Nigeria Category:Mass murder in 2020 Category:Massacres in Africa Category:November 2020 events Category:Terrorist incidents in 2020 Category:Terrorist incidents in Africa in the 2020s
title: Koshebe massacre
